current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to regulate
		  payroll tax deposit agents, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Small Business Payroll Protection Act
			 of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Regulation of payroll
			 tax deposit agents

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish a system to require the
				initial registration and the annual renewal of the registration of persons
				seeking to act as payroll tax deposit agents authorized to make Federal
				employment tax deposits on behalf of employer taxpayers. Such system shall
				also—

text.#text: The

establish a
				registration and renewal fee for each payroll tax deposit agent in an amount
				not to exceed $100,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or submitting to a quarterly certification as specified in

text.#text:
provide the
				payroll tax deposit agent the option of either submitting a bond as specified
				in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , and

text.#text:
require such
				disclosures as are specified in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in an amount not to exceed
				$10,000 for each 90 days of noncompliance.

text.#text:
provide penalties
				for unregistered persons acting as payroll tax deposit agents with respect to
				Federal tax deposits and for payroll tax deposit agents who fail to furnish
				such disclosures as are specified in

term.#tail:
means any person which provides payroll
				processing or tax filing and deposit services to 1 or more employers (other
				than an employer acting on its own behalf) if such person has the contractual
				authority to access such employer’s funds for the purpose of making employment
				tax deposits. Such term shall not include any person which only transfers such
				funds to the appropriate government authority (regardless if such person has
				the authority to determine the amount of such transfer) and does not otherwise
				have the authority to access such funds.

text.#text: For purposes of this section, the term

Definition of
				payroll tax deposit agent

, the amount of such bond shall be not less than
				$50,000 nor more than $500,000, and shall be determined with respect to each
				payroll tax deposit agent under regulations prescribed by the

text.#text:
If a payroll tax deposit agent elects to submit a bond
				under

Any
				bond or security furnished pursuant to this section shall be in such form and
				with such surety or sureties as may be prescribed by regulations issued
				pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with
				the initial registration and each annual renewal of the registration of persons

text.#text: Evidence of such bond shall be filed with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and no payroll tax deposit agent shall obtain its annual renewal of

continuation-text.#text:
A copy of
				each completed quarterly certification report shall be filed quarterly with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, such certification shall
				be performed by an independent third party who is qualified to perform such
				certifications under targeted criteria established by the

, at the
				direction of the

, and shall be based on the following narrowly
				targeted principles—

text.#text:
If a payroll tax deposit agent elects to submit to
				a quarterly certification under

that the escrow
				account of the payroll tax deposit agent in which such agent holds its
				employers’ taxes is balanced to the total of quarterly reconciliation
				statements (i.e., Internal Revenue Service Forms 941 and State equivalents),
				and any liabilities collected but not yet deposited with the respective
				government authority,

that the escrow
				account funds of the payroll tax deposit agent are not commingled with such
				agent's operating funds,

that there is no
				evidence that the payroll tax deposit agent used any of the funds in such
				agent's escrow account to pay such agent's operating costs, and

that there is
				adequate receipt evidence that such agent paid the required employment taxes on
				behalf of the employers to the proper government employment tax
				authority.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall require payroll tax deposit agents to disclose to each client
				prior to or at the time of contracting for payroll services, and to each
				existing client at least quarterly—

text.#text: The

the client’s
				continuing liability for payment of all Federal and State employment taxes
				notwithstanding any contractual relationship with a payroll tax deposit
				agent,

the mechanisms
				available to the client to verify the amount and date of payment of all tax
				deposits made by the payroll tax deposit agent on behalf of such client,
				including the Internet address and telephone number of each Federal and State
				employment tax authority related to such deposits, and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines is necessary or appropriate to assist
				employers in the selection and use of payroll tax deposit agents.

text.#text:
such other
				information that the

Only persons registered under this section
				may—

make Federal tax
				deposits on behalf of an employer,

sign and file
				Federal employment tax returns on behalf of a taxpayer, and

have access to
				confidential tax information relating to such employer.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall prescribe such regulations as may be necessary to carry out the
				provisions of this
				section.
